desc: Students delve further into the topics of kinetics, thermodynamics and atomic and molecular structure that were introduced in the first-year courses. This course emphasizes the mathematical aspects of chemistry. Specific topics include reaction mechanisms, the laws of thermodynamics, statistical thermodynamics, equilibrium, spectroscopy and molecular orbital theory. Prerequisites: Chemistry 126 and concurrent registration in Chemistry 357. Previous completion of Physics 124 or 126 is recommended. Offered both semesters.
name: Physical Chemistry
prerequisites: Prerequisites: Chemistry 126 and concurrent registration in Chemistry 357. Previous completion of Physics 124 or 126 is recommended. Offered both semesters.
